result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Waits was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

Assessment,treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
May transfer to county of residence. 
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at agent's discretion but ONLY with prior authorization of the Court.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:02 am 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays. 
Date and time set for hearing on request for sentence modification. 
Atty Abernethy-Mays requests deft do community service instead of conditional jail time. 
State objects. 
COURT modifies probation on Ct. 1 and STAYS 30 days MCJ conditional jail time to be used at discretion of agent but only with prior authorization of the Court. 
COURT notes it would seriously consider lifting stayed jail time if deft was to become unemployed. 
Adj: 9:05 am
Hearing on August 10, 2016 at 08:45 am.

w/letter to Judge Jacobson from U-Line Corporation
Court grants request for extension of time to report to jail for 30 days - signed 7/15/16
from U-Line Corp to Judge Jacobson and letter re: sentence modification
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:29 pm 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy- Mays. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 4 (Possess with intent THC)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITION: 30 days MCJ with huber or EMP if def qualifies with up to 60 days to begin. 
                           : On Ct. 5>>SWH for 1 year probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS on BOTH: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation/conditional jail to def's county of residence.

State has no objections.  
COURT stays day reporting during time deft will be in Florida.
